metadata.scenario: Customer service interaction about a delayed package

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about an order I placed last week. The tracking number is 1Z234ABCDEFG.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, one moment while I pull up the information for tracking number 1Z234ABCDEFG. ...Okay, I see the order. It's currently showing as 'In Transit'. What is your specific concern?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: The estimated delivery date was yesterday! I needed this package for a project I'm working on, and now I'm behind. What's going on?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let me check for any updates regarding the delay. It appears there was a slight weather-related disruption at one of our sorting facilities, which may have impacted the delivery schedule.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: A 'slight' disruption? Yesterday is gone! When can I actually expect it? Can you give me a real date this time, not just an 'estimate'?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I can certainly understand your concern. Let me see if I can get more precise information. Based on the latest data, the package is now expected to arrive within the next 24-48 hours. I will also mark this package for priority delivery.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: And what happens if it doesn't arrive in 48 hours? What guarantees do I have? And why wasn't I notified of this delay proactively? Shouldn't you guys be informing customers about these things?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: If the package does not arrive within 48 hours, please contact us again, and we can initiate a trace on the package and explore options such as a refund for the shipping costs. We are working on improving our proactive notification system, and I apologize that you were not informed earlier. I can add you to receive SMS updates if you'd like.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, fine. Add me to the SMS updates. My number is 555-123-4567. I really hope this arrives soon.
